thread.title: Replacing Romo, Dez and DeMarco Murray: Vote and grade these 10 Dallas Cowboys players, units
thread.title_full: Replacing Romo, Dez and DeMarco Murray: Vote and grade these 10 Dallas Cowboys players, units | Dallas Morning News

author: SportsDayDFW.com
title: Replacing Romo, Dez and DeMarco Murray: Vote and grade these 10 Dallas Cowboys players, units
text:
The Dallas Cowboys are three weeks into survival mode with quarterback Tony Romo and wide receiver Dez Bryant sidelined with injuries. In just five games it feels as if Cowboys fans have experienced all kinds of emotions with two division wins and three straight losses without its two star players.
With Romo and Bryant out, other players have had to step up. Naturally, some have done better than others.
Below are 10 units or players that have been focal points of the Cowboys' season so far. Under each description, there are polls to vote in to grade their performance so far.
1). The offensive line After an offseason of hype around how good the Cowboys' offensive line was going to be, fans might have been hit with a let down through five games. Special contributor Bob Sturm and insider David Moore have both touched on why they think the unit has struggled at times this year.
Sure, not having Tony Romo or DeMarco Murray might be contributing to the unit's production this year, but the line is made up of all of the same players from a year ago, plus rookie La'el Collins, who many pegged as a first-round talent.
What grade should the Cowboys' offensive line receive?
2. Brandon Weeden Weeden was given the keys to a 2-0 Cowboys team and subsequently handed them off to Matt Cassel after going 0-3 as the replacement starter. And he's "pissed" about that .
The unluckiest quarterback alive played decently enough to keep the Cowboys in a couple games and then got blown out by the defending Super Bowl champion New England Patriots.
So much was made about the dink-and-dunk play calling from head coach Jason Garrett, but Bob Sturm said that Weeden was the reason that the offense was limited .
What grade should Brandon Weeden receive?
3. Jason Witten Texas Rangers third baseman Adrian Beltre got some deserved high praise for playing injured for the second half of the lengthy baseball season and in the playoffs. Not much is different about Witten.
All he's done is play through a sprained knee and two sprained ankles . That kind of toughness drew praise from Patriots tight end Rob Gronkowski .
What grade should Jason Witten receive?
4. Sean Lee Doesn't it feel good to have Robot Sean Lee back?
The linebacker leads the Cowboys with 41 total tackles despite missing time from a cut lip that needed stitches and a concussion against the New Orleans Saints. Once again, health remains a huge factor for Lee.
However, as David Moore points out here , Sean Lee is a linebacking genius.
What grade should Sean Lee receive?
5. Lucky Whitehead Coming into this season, Whitehead was pegged as a special teams savior that could replace the production that Dwayne Harris left when he signed with the New York Giants. He's since been replaced by Cole Beasley on punt returns.
Whitehead has one kickoff return for 21 yards and one kickoff return for negative two yards. As a receiver, he has one catch for negative three yards.
What grade should Lucky Whitehead receive?
6. Greg Hardy Not a bad season debut, eh? The one on the field wasn't too shabby. Off the field....there's more to be desired. Especially given all of the backlash from his "guns blazing" and talk about Tom Brady's wife.
Hardy was called a "garbage human" being by Fox Sports 1's Katie Nolan and CBS Sports' Jim Nantz also criticized the defensive end . And then there was that rap music video that didn't help his case.
As Kevin Sherrington writes, has Hardy learned his lesson ?
What grade should Greg Hardy receive?
7. Joseph Randle Replacing DeMarco Murray is no easy task, and the Cowboys' front office wasn't sure if Randle could do it alone so they went and assembled a running back committee. Randle splits time with Darren McFadden, Lance Dunbar (who is out for the year) and Christine Michael.
Fans have seen some flashes of hope (think in the Atlanta game where he dominated the first half on the ground) and signs of concern ( that touchdown dive against the Saints ).
His best statistical game has come against the Falcons where he rushed for 87 yards and three touchdowns, but he wasn't much of a factor in the second half.
What grade should Joseph Randle receive?
8. Darren McFadden Randle's counterpart, McFadden, has stayed relatively healthy, which was a concern when the Cowboys went out and got him to be part of the committee. He hasn't cracked 35 rushing yards in the five games this season (albeit he's only averaged 7.4 carries per game), but he has factored nicely into the passing game catching 12 passes for 102 yards.
What grade should Darren McFadden receive?
9. Defensive backs Before Hardy showed up to bolster the pass rush, the secondary had to go up against high-powered offenses that featured players like Matt Ryan, Julio Jones, Drew Brees and Odell Beckham Jr without its top cornerback in Orlando Scandrick.
Barry Church leads the unit in total tackles with 37, but missed a key tackle in the team's overtime loss to the Saints. Brandon Carr, Morris Claiborne, J.J. Wilcox and rookie Byron Jones have all accumulated at least 14 tackles and one pass deflection. Wilcox is the lone member with an interception.
What grade should the defensive backs receive?
10. Wide receivers When Dez Bryant went down with an injury, the team's best receiver might have been Lance Dunbar, who also got injured. That left Terrance Williams, Cole Beasley and Brice Butler to pick up the slack.
Butler's success was short lived. After the Cowboys gave up a fifth-round pick to get him , he caught a 67-yard pass against the Saints before injuring his hamstring on that very play .
Williams was a no show against the Falcons where he dropped a pass on fourth down to end the game. He then lashed out at fans on Twitter after the drop .
What grade should the wide receivers receive?
